questions.question_text: Which address is required to create a video endpoint in Cisco Unified Communications Manager?

discussion.content: I agree with trikatsu. The answer is A, MAC Address.
Correct answer is D - MAC Address

questions.question_text: A Cisco administrator is asked to set up two new end users in Cisco Unified Communication Manager. Which two fields are required? (Choose two.)

discussion.content: Use ID & Last Name are mandatory fields in end user page
Sorry B,F Last Na and Userid :)
should this be, user id and last name?

SCCP phone obtains the Power (PoE or AC adaptor).
The phone loads its locally stored firmware image.
The phone learns the Voice VLAN ID via CDP from the switch.
The phone uses DHCP to learn its IP address, subnet mask, default gateway and TFTP server address.
The phone contacts the TFTP server and requests its configuration file. Each phone has a customised configuration file named SEP<mac_address>.cnf.xml created by CUCM and uploaded to TFTP when the administrator creates or modifies the phone.
The phone registers with the primary CUCM server listed in its configuration file. CUCM then sends the soft-key template to the phone using SCCP messages.

Follow the below link for both SIP and SCCP registration process

https://ipwithease.com/ip-phone-registration-process/

questions.question_text:
DRAG DROP -
Drag the IP Phone Registration steps on the left with the steps on the right.
Select and Place:
//IMG//
What is the unique identifier that is used to register an IP phone endpoint to Cisco Unified Communications Manager?

discussion.content:
Identification by MAC address â€“ IP phones are actually identified in the system by that unique MAC address, not by their IP addresses. That's how we know our phones. When we configure them, we have to put in the MAC addresses.
https://www.learncisco.net/courses/icomm-ccna-voice/endpoint-and-user-administration/cucm-ip-phone-registration.html
That is part of the most basic information you need to set up a phone, there isn't even an option to input an ip address for a phone on CUCM

MAC address - Just google the question its straight forward on google!!!
MAC Address: The MAC address is the unique identifier that links the IP Phone hardware to the software configuration in CUCM.

questions.question_text: Which two options are configured on the phone configuration page within Cisco Unified Communications Manager Administrator? (Choose two.)

discussion.content: Answer is Device Pool and MAC Address.
